discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
as the question is for vedge so B and E are the correct answers

Thread Grid on vEdge? no way
For this is utilized sandbox built on VM

Selected Answer: BE
B: seems logical
E:https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/ios-xe-17/security-book-xe/url-filtering.html

choices.D: Cisco AMP and AMP Threat Grid

questions.question_text: What are three types of data that JSON uses when Cisco APIC REST API uses JavaScript?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
not sure what this question has got to do with Ciasco SD-WAN

Selected Answer: B
B
JSON supports mainly 6 data types: 

 String
 Number
 Boolean
 Null
 Object
 Array
A JSON scalar can be a string, number, null, or Boolean

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A WAN Edge router is configured with SLAs. Which TLOC does the traffic take if the internet TLOC has latency 100 ms, loss 2%, jitter 50ms, and the MPLS TLOC has latency 50 ms, loss 1%, and jitter 150 ms?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I agree with mikidvd51. Both MPLS and Internet are within the defined SLA class and both are compliant. In that case, traffic can traverse through both MPLS and Internet based on the principles of application aware routing. Following snippet is from Cisco Press Book "Another variation of this configuration is where the SLA Class action is specified but no preferred color is specified. In this case, the traffic is load-shared per flow among all of the colors that meet the required SLA."

Selected Answer: A
As this is Application-aware routing policy, SLA is irrelevant for this as both TLOCs are within SLA defined. But MPLS has better metrics so it will be preffered over Internet.

comments.content: Are you sure? Both circuits meet criteria. What about C

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A - MPLS, because jitter is not set up in policy

discussion.content:
